alert.note: Alert for Northampton (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 18 at 6:23AM EST until December 19 at 8:13AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northern New Jersey, including the following county, Warren. Portions of Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Monroe and Northampton. * WHEN...Until 930 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 622 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. An additional 0.5 inches to 1 inch is possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Easton, East Stroudsburg, Blairstown, Bangor, Pen Argyl, Wind Gap, Belvidere, Harmony, Oxford, Hope, East Bangor, and Delaware Water Gap. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 22. Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 295 and 314. Interstate 380 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 1. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
